The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is incapacitated.
description |Parry| The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.
description |Spellcasting| 5th-level spellcaster, ability is Wisdom (DC13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). Prepared cleric spells:
bullet |Cantrips (at will):| light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
bullet |1st level (4 slots):| cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary
bullet |2nd level (3 slots):| lesser restoration, spiritual weapon
bullet |3rd level (2 slots):| dispel magic, spirit guardians
description |Mace| Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

description |Multiattack| The spy makes two melee attacks.

description |Hand Crossbow| Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

title: Banderhobb
contents: property | Language | Understands Common and the languages of its creator, but can't speak

description |Resonant Connection| If the banderhobb has even a tiny piece of a creature or an obect in its possession, such as a lock of hair or a splinter of wood, it knows the most direct route to that creature or object if it is within1 mile of the banderhobb.
description |Shadow Stealth| While in dim light or darkness, the banderhobb can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (5d6+5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the banderhobb can't use its bite attack or tongue attack on another target.

title: Banderhobb Continued: Actions
contents: description |Tongue| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Strength savng throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled to a space within 5 feet of the banderhobb, which can use a bonus action to make a bite attack against the target.

description |Swallow| The banderhobb makes a bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the banderhobb and it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of the banderhobb's turns. A creature reduced to 0 hit points in this way stops taking necrotic damage and becomes stable. The banderhobb can have only one target swallowed at a time. While the banderhobb isn't incapacitated, it can regurgitate the creature at any time (no action required) in a space within 5 feet of it. The creature exits prone. If the banderhobb dies, it likewise regurgitates a swallowed creature.

description |Shadow Step| The banderhobb magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space of dim light or darkness that it can see. Before or after teleporting, it can make a bite or tongue attack.

title: Barghest
contents: property | Damage Resistances | Cold, Fire, Lightning; Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Skills | Deception +4, Intimidation +4, Perc. +5, Stealth +4
property | Senses | Blindsight 60ft, Darkvision 60ft, Passive Perception 15
property | Language | Abyssal, Common, Goblin, Infernal; Telep. 60ft.

description |Shapechanger| The barghest can use its action to polymorph into a Small goblin or back into its true form. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The barghest reverts to its true form if it dies.

description |Fire Banishment| When the barghest starts its turn engulfed in flames that are at least 10 feet high or wide, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be instantly banished to Gehenna. Instantaneous bursts of flame (such as a red dragon's breath or a fireball spell) don't have this effect on the barghest.

title: Barghest Continued: Actions
contents: description |Keen Smell| The barghest has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
description |Innate Spellcasting| The barghest's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components::
bullet | At will:| levitate, minor illusion, pass without trace

description |Soul Feeding| A barghest can feed on the corpse of a humanoid that it killed that has been dead for less than 10 minutes, devouring both flesh and soul in doing so. This feeding takes at least 1 minute, and it destroys the victim's body. The victim's soul is trapped in the barghest for 24 hours, after which time it is digested. If the barghest dies before the soul is digested, the soul is released. While a humanoid's soul is trapped in a barghest, any form of revival that could work has only a 50 percent chance of doing so, freeing the soul from the barghest if it is successful. Once a creature's soul is digested, however, no mortal magic can return that humanoid to life.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) piercing damage.
description |Claws| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) slashing damage.

title: Death Kiss
contents: description|Lightning Blood| A creature within 5 feet of the death kiss takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage whenever it hits the death kiss with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.
description|Multiattack| The death kiss makes three tentacle attacks. Up to three of these attacks can be replaced by Blood Drain, one replacement per tentacle grappling a creature

title: Death Kiss Continued: Legendary
contents: description|Tentacle| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6+4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the death kiss can't use the same tentacle on another target. The death kiss has ten tentacles.

description|Blood Drain| One creature grappled by a tentacle of the death kiss must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage, and the death kiss regains half as many hit points.

title: Gauth
contents: property | Saving Throws | Int +5, Wis +5, Cha +4

description |Stunning Gaze| When a creature that can see the gauth's central eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the gauth, the gauth can force it to make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw if the gauth isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. A creature that fails the save is stunned until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the gauth in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

description |Death Throes| When the gauth dies, the magical energy within it explodes, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

title: Gauth Continued: Actions
contents: description |Bite| Melee Weapon: +8, 5ft. Hit: 9 (2d8) piercing damage.
description |Eye Rays| Shoots three magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choose one to three targets in 120 feet of it:

description |1. Devour Magic:| DC14 Dexterity save. Failure: one magic item loses all magical properties until gauth's next turn. Also loses 1d4 charges on charmed items. Determine affected item randomly, ignores one-use items (i.e. potions & scrolls)
description |2. Enervation Ray:| targeted creature makes DC 14 Constitution save, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

description |3. Pushing Ray:| targeted creature makes DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet directly away from the gauth and have its speed halved until the start of the gauth's next turn.
description |4. Fire Ray:| The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (4d10) fire damage.

description |5. Paralyzing Ray:| The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

description |6. Sleep Ray:| The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

title: Gazer
contents: description |Aggressive| As a bonus action, the gazer can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

description |Mimicry| The gazer can mimic simple sounds of speech it has heard, in any language. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

title: Gazer Continued: Actions
contents: description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.
description |Eye Rays| The gazer shoots two of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one or two targets it can see within 60 feet of it:

description |1. Dazing Ray:| The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the start of the gazer's next turn. While the target is charmed in this way, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls.
description |2. Fear Ray:| The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the gazer's next turn.
description |3. Frost Ray:| The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

description |4. Telekinetic Ray:| If the target is a creature that is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet directly away from the gazer. If the target is an object weighing 10 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, the gazer moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. The gazer can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a container.

title: Bodak
contents: property | Damage Resistances | Cold, Fire, Necrotic: Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Frightened, Poisoned
property | Language | Abyssal, the languages it knew in life

description |Aura of Annihilation| The bodak can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bodak. Undead and fiends ignore this effect.

title: Bodak Continued: Actions
contents: description |Death Gaze| When a creature that can see the bodak’s eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the bodak, the bodak can force it to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw if the bodak isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, unless it is immune to the frightened condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so. it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bodak until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw.
description |Sunlight Hypersensitivity| The bodak takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
description |Fist| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

description |Withering Gaze| One creature that the bodak can see within 60 feet of it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

title: Boggle
contents: property | Skills | Perception +3, Sleight of Hand +6, Stealth +6

description |Boggle Oil| The boggle excretes nonflammable oil from its pores. The boggle chooses whether the oil is slippery or sticky and can change the oil on its skin from one consistency to another as a bonus action.
Slippery Oil: While coated in slippery oil, the boggle gains advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to escape bonds, squeeze through narrow spaces, and end grapples.
Sticky Oil: While coated in sticky oil, the boggle gains advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple and any ability check made to maintain a hold on another creature, a surface, or an object. The boggle can also climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

title: Boggle Continued: Actions
contents: description |Dimensional Rift| Bonus action, creates invisible & immobile rift in opening or frame in 5ft, space no bigger than 10ft on any side. Bridges distance between that space & any point within 30ft of boggle. While next to the rift, the boggle can see through it and is considered to be next to the destination as well, and anything the boggle puts through the rift (including a portion of its body) emerges at the destination. Only the boggle can use the rift, and it lasts until the end of the boggle's next turn.
description |Uncanny Smell| Advantage on Perception checks by smell.
description |Pummel| Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6-1) bludgeoning damage.

description |Oil Puddle| Creates a puddle of oil that is either slippery or sticky (boggle's choice). The puddle is 1 inch deep & covers the ground in the boggle's space. The puddle is difficult terrain For all creatures except boggles and lasts for 1 hour.
If the oil is slippery, any creature that enters the puddle's area or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.
If the oil is sticky, any creature that enters the puddle's area or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be restrained. On its turn. a creature can use an action to try to extricate itself from the sticky puddle, ending the effect and moving into the nearest safe unoccupied space with a successful DC 11 Strength check.

title: Catoblepas
contents: description |Keen Smell| Advantage on Perception checks by smell.
description |Stench| Other creatures starting within 10ft make DC16 Constitution save. Failure: poisoned until the start of the creature’s next turn. Success: immune to stench for 1 hour.

description |Tail| Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (5d6+4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

description |Death Ray (Recharge 5-6)| Targets a creature visible in 30ft of it. The target must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

title: Cave Fisher
contents: description |Adhesive Filament| Can use its action to extend a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the filament is grappled by the cave fisher (escape DC 13), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage), but a weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful DC 13 Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament causes no damage to the cave fisher, which can extrude a replacement filament on its next turn
description |Flammable Blood| If the cave fisher drops to half its hit points or fewer, it gains vulnerability to fire damage.
description |Spider Climb| Can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

title: Cave Fisher Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| Makes two attacks with its claws.
description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 it, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage.

description |Filament| One creature grappled by the cave fisher’s adhesive filament must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw, provided that the target weighs 200 pounds or less. On a failure, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cave fisher, and the cave fisher makes a claw attack against it as a bonus action. Reeling up the target releases anyone else who was attached to the filament. Until the grapple ends on the target, the cave fisher can’t extrude another filament.

title: Chitine
contents: property | Senses | Darkvision 60 ft, Passive Perception 10
description |Fey Ancestry| Advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put the chitine to sleep.
description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the chitine has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description |Web Sense| While in a web, the chitine knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.
description |Web Walker| Ignores restrictions caused by webbing.
description |Multiattack| Makes three attacks with its daggers.
description |Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing.

title: Choldrith
contents: property | Senses | Darkvision 60 ft, Passive Perception 12
description |Fey Ancestry| The choldrith has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put the choldrith to sleep.

description |Spellcasting| The choldrith is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The choldrith has the following cleric spells prepared:
bullet |1st level (4 slots):| bane, healing word, sanctuary, shield of faith
description |Spider Climb| The choldrith can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

title: Choldrith Continued: Actions
contents: description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the choldrith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description |Web Sense| While in contact with a web, the choldrith knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.
description |Web Walker| The choldrith ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
description |Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

description |Web (Recharge 5-6)| Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 11 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

title: Cranium Rat
contents: property | Senses | Darkvision 30 ft, Passive Perception 10
description |Illumination| As a bonus action, the cranium rat can shed dim light from its brain in a 5-foot radius or extinguish the light.
description |Telepathic Shroud| The cranium rat is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as i to all divination spells.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

title: Swarm of Cranium Rat
contents: subtitle | Medium Swarm of Tiny Beasts, Lawful Evil
property | Damage Resistances | All from Physical weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Prone, Restrained, Stunned
property | Senses | Darkvision 30 ft, Passive Perception 10

description |Illumination| As a bonus action, the swarm can shed dim light from its brains in a 5-foot radius, increase the illumination to bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius (and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius), or extinguish the light.

description |Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)| The swarm's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13). As long as it has more than half of its hit points, it can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

title: Swarm of Cranium Rat Continued: Actions
contents: description |Swarm| The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.
description |Telepathic Shroud| The swarm is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. as well as to all divination spells.

description |Bites| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm’s space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

title: Darkling
contents: property | Skills | Acrobatics +5, Deception +2, Perception +5, Stealth +7
property | Senses | Blindsight 30ft, Darkvision 120ft, Passive Perc. 15

description |Death Flash| On death, nonmagical light 10ft radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area and able to see the bright light must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature’s next turn.
description |Light Sensitivity| While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

description |Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the darkling has advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

title: Darkling Elder
contents: property | Skills | Acrobatics +5, Deception +3, Perception +6, Stealth +7
property | Senses | Blindsight 30ft, Darkvision 120ft, Passive Perc. 16

description |Death Burn| On death, magical light 10ft radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area make DC 11 Constitution save. Failure:, the creature takes 7 (2d6) radiant damage and, if the creature can see the light, is blinded until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw is successful, the creature takes half the damage and isn’t blinded.
description |Multiattack| The darkling elder makes two melee attacks.
description |Shortsword| Melee Weapon: +5 to hit, reach 5 fit, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing. Ifelder had advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals as: extra 10 (3d6) piercing.
description |Darkness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)| Casts darkness with no components using Wisdom

title: Deep Scion
contents: property | Skills | Deception +6, Insight +3, Sleight of Hand +3, Stealth +3
property | Language | Aquan, Common, thieves' cant

description |Shapechanger| The deep scion can use its action to polymorph into a humanoid-piscine hybrid form, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. The deep scion reverts to its true form if it dies.
description |Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)| The deep scion can breathe air and water.

title: Deep Scion Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| In humanoid form, the deep scion makes two melee attacks. In hybrid form, the deep scion makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.
description |Battleaxe (Humanoid Form Only)| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10+4) slashing damage if used with two hands.
description |Bite (Hybrid Form Only)| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one creature. Hit: 6 (1d4+4) piercing damage.
description |Claw (Hybrid Form Only)| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) slashing damage.

description |Psychic Screech (Hybrid Form Only| Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). The deep scion emits a terrible scream audible within 300 feet. Creatures within 30 feet of the deep scion must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the deep scion’s next turn. In water, the psychic screech also telepathically transmits the deep scion’s memories of the last 24 hours to its master, regardless of distance, so long as it and its master are in the same body of water.

title: Babau
contents: property | Damage Resistences | Cold, Fire, Lightning; All physical from non-magical weapons
description |Innate Spellcasting| The babau's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11). The babau can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

title: Babau Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| The babau makes two melee attacks. It can also use Weakening Gaze before or after making these attacks.
description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) slashing damage.

description |Spear| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 it, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8+4) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

description |Weakening Gaze| The babau targets one creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

title: Maw Demon
contents: property | Damage Resistences | Cold, Fire, Lightning
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Frightened, Poisoned
property | Language | Understands Abyssal but can't speak
description |Rampage| When it reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the maw demon can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8+2) piercing damage.

title: Shoosuva
contents: property | Damage Resistences | Cold, Fire, Lightning; Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Frightened, Poisoned
property | Saving Throws | Dex +4, Con +6, Wis +5
property | Language | Abyssal, Gnoll, Telepathy 120 ft.
description |Rampage| At 0 HP from melee attack on its turn, takes bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.
description |Multiattack| Two attacks: one Bite and one Tail stinger.
description |Bite| Melee: +7 to hit, 5ft reach. Hit: 26 (4d10+4) piercing.

description |Tail Stinger| Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft, one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) piercing, and target makes DC14 Constitution save or poisoned. While poisoned, the target is also paralyzed. Can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

title: Devourer
contents: property | Damage Resistences | Cold, Fire, Lightning
description |Multiattack| The devourer makes two claw attacks and can use either Imprison Soul or Soul Rend.
description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6+5) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

title: Devourer Continued: Actions
contents: description |Imprison Soul| The devourer chooses a living humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature is teleported inside the devourer’s ribcage and imprisoned there. A creature imprisoned in this manner has disadvantage on death saving throws. If it dies while imprisoned, the devourer regains 25 hit points, immediately recharges Soul Rend, and gains an additional action on its next turn. Additionally, at the start of its next turn, the devourer regurgitates the slain creature as a bonus action, and the creature becomes an undead. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. if it had 3 to 5 Hit Dice, it becomes a ghoul. Otherwise, it becomes a wight. A devourer can imprison only one creature at a time.

description |Soul Rend (Recharge 6)| The devourer creates a vortex of life-draining energy in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each humanoid in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Increase the damage by 10 for each living humanoid with 0 hit points in that area.

title: Dimetrodon
contents: description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6+2) piercing damage.

title: Brontosaurus
contents: description |Stomp| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d8+5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
description |Tail| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (6d8+5) bludgeoning damage.

title: Deinonychus
contents: description |Pounce| If the deinonychus moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the deinonychus can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action
description |Multiattack| The deinonychus makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.
description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) slashing damage.

title: Hadrosaurus
contents: description |Tail| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) bludgeoning damage.

title: Quetzalcoatlus
contents: description |Dive Attack| If the quetzalcoatlus is flying and dives at least 30 feet toward a target and then hits with a bite attack, the attack deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage to the target.
description |Flyby| The quetzalcoatlus doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (3d6+2) piercing damage.

title: Stegosaurus
contents: description |Tail| Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (6d6+5) piercing damage.

title: Velociraptor
contents: description |Pack Tactics| The velociraptor has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the velociraptor’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.
description |Multiattack| The velociraptor makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.
description |Claws| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) slashing damage.

title: Draegloth
contents: property | Damage Resistances | Cold, Fire, Lightning
description |Fey Ancestry| Adv. on saves for charmed, & sleep from magic
description |Innate Spellcasting| Spellcasting ability is Charisma (DC 11). Innately cast following spells, no material components:
description |Multiattack| Three attacks: one Bite and two Claws.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (2d10+5) piercing damage.
description |Claws| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10+5) slashing damage.

title: Firenewt Warrior
contents: description |Amphibious| The firenewt can breathe air and water.
description |Multiattack| The firenewt makes two attacks with its scimitar.
description |Scimitar| Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) slashing damage.

description |Spit Fire (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)| The firenewt spits fire at a creature within 10 feet of it. The creature must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

title: Giant Strider
contents: description |Fire Absorption| Whenever the giant strider is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to half the fire damage dealt.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) piercing damage.

description |Fire Burst (Recharges 5-6)| Hurls a gout of flame at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners, and it ignites flammable objects in that area that aren’t being worn or carried.

title: Firenewt Warlock of Imix
contents: property | Armor class | 10 (13 with mage armor)
property | Senses | Darkvision 120 ft, Passive Perception 10
description |Amphibious| The firenewt can breathe air and water.
description |Innate Spellcasting| Spellcasting ability is Charisma. Innately cast mage armor (self only) at will, no material components.
description |Spellcasting| 3rd-level spellcaster uses Charisma (DC12, +4 on spell attacks). Regains spells on short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:
description |1st-2nd level (2 2nd-level slots):| burning hands, flaming sphere, hellish rebuke, scorching ray
description |Imix's Blessing| At 0HP, gains 5 temporary hit points.

title: Flail Snail
contents: property | Senses | Darkvision 60ft, Tremorsense 60ft, Passive Perc. 10

description |Antimagic Shell| Advantage on saves against spells, and creatures making a spell attack against snail: disadvantage. Successful saves on spells or spell attacks, an additional effect might occur, as determined by rolling a d6:

description |1-2:| If spell is AoE or multiple targets, it fails. If the spell targets only the snail, it has no effect on the snail and is reflected back at the caster, using the spell slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the caster.

description |5-6:| The snail’s shell converts some of the spell's energy into a burst of destructive force. Each creature within 30 feet of the snail must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 1d6 force damage per level of the spell on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

title: Flail Snail Continued: Actions
contents: description |Flail Tentacles| The flail snail has five flail tentacles. Whenever the snail takes 10 damage or more on a single turn, one of its tentacles dies. If even one tentacle remains, the snail regrows all dead ones within 1d4 days. If all its tentacles die, the snail retracts into its shell, gaining total cover, and it begins wailing, a sound that can be heard for 600 feet, stopping only when it dies 5d6 minutes later. Healing magic that restores limbs, such as the regenerate spell, can halt this dying process.
description |Multiattack| The flail snail makes as many flail tentacle attacks as it has flail tentacles, all against the same target.
description |Flail Tentacle| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) bludgeoning damage.

description |Scintillating Shell (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)| The snail's shell emits dazzling, colored light until the end of the snail’s next turn. During this time, the shell sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet, and creatures that can see the snail have disadvantage on attack rolls against it. In addition, any creature within the bright light and able to see the snail when this power is activated must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the light ends.
description |Shell Defense| The flail snail withdraws into its shell, gaining a +4 bonus to AC until it emerges. It can emerge from its shell as a bonus action on its turn.

title: Froghemoth
contents: description |Amphibious| The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

description |Shock Suscptibility| If the froghemoth takes lightning damage, it suffers several effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, it can’t use reactions or Multiattack, and on its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both.
description |Multiattack| The froghemoth makes two attacks with its tentacles. It can also use its tongue or bite.

title: Froghemoth Continued: Actions
contents: description |Tentacle| Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the froghemoth can’t use this tentacle on another target. The froghemoth has four tentacles.

description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10+6) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth’s turns.
The froghemoth’s gullet can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the Froghemoth takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Froghemoth must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth. If the froghemoth dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

description |Tongue| The Froghemoth targets one Medium or smaller creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the froghemoth, and the froghemoth can make a bite attack against it as a bonus action.

title: Cloud Giant Smiling One
contents: subtitle | Huge Giant (Cloud Giant), Chaotic Neutral
property | Saving Throws | Con +10, Int +6, Wis +7
property | Skills | Deception +11, Insight +7, Perception +7, Sleight of Hand +9
description |Innate Spellcasting| Spellcasting ability Charisma (DC15). No material components required:
description |Spellcasting| 5th-level spellcaster ability is Charisma (DC15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Following bard spells prepared:
bullet |1st level (4 slots):| cure wounds, disguise self, silent image, Tasha’s hideous laughter

title: Cloud Giant Smiling One Continued: Actions
contents: description |Keen Smell| The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
description |Multiattack| The giant makes two attacks with its morningstar.

description |Morningstar| Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8+8) bludgeoning damage. The attack deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage if the giant has advantage on the attack roll.

description |Rock| Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10+8) bludgeoning damage. The attack deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage if the giant has advantage on the attack roll.

description |Change Shape| The giant magically polymorphs into a beast or humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Any equipment the giant is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

title: Fire Giant Dreadnought
contents: subtitle | Huge Giant (Fire Giant), Lawful Evil
property | Saving Throws | Dex +4, Con +11, Cha +5
description |Dual Shields| The giant carries two shields, each of which is accounted for in the giant’s AC. The giant must stow or drop one of its shields to hurl rocks.
description |Multiattack| The giant makes two fireshield attacks.
description |Fireshield| Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d6+8) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

title: Fire Giant Continued: Actions
contents: description |Rock| Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range 60/240 ft, one target. Hit: 30 (4d10+8) bludgeoning damage.

description |Shield Charge| The giant moves up to 30 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature smaller than Huge. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, it makes a fireshield attack against that creature. If the attack hits, the target must also succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or be pushed ahead of the giant for the rest of this move. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is also knocked prone and takes 18 (3d6+8) bludgeoning damage, or 29 (6d6+8) bludgeoning damage if it was already prone.

title: Frost Giant Everlasting One
contents: subtitle | Huge Giant (Frost Giant), Chaotic Evil
property | Saving Throws | Str +11, Con +11, Wis +4

description |Extra Heads| The giant has a 25 percent chance of having more than one head. If it has more than one, it has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

description |Regeneration| The giant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the giant takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The giant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

title: Frost Giant Everlasting One Continued: Actions
contents: description |Vaprak's Rage (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)| As a bonus action, the giant can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the giant is incapacitated. While raging, the giant gains the following benefits:
bullet ||The giant has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws
bullet ||When it makes a melee weapon attack, the giant gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
bullet ||The giant has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
description |Multiattack| The giant makes two attacks with its greataxe.
description |Greataxe| Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12+7) slashing damage, or 30 (3d12+11) slashing damage while raging.
description |Rock| Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10+7) bludgeoning damage.

title: Mouth of Grolantor
contents: subtitle | Huge Giant (Hill Giant), Chaotic Evil

description |Mouth of Madness| The giant is immune to confusion spells and similar magic. On each of its turns, the giant uses all its movement to move toward the nearest creature or whatever else it might perceive as food. Roll a d10 at the start of each of the giant’s turns to determine its action for that turn:

bullet |1-3| The giant makes three attacks with its fists against one random target within its reach. If no other creatures are within its reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
bullet |4-5| The giant makes one attack with its fist against every creature within its reach. If no other creatures are within its reach, the giant makes one fist attack against itself.

title: Mouth of Grolantor Continued: Actions
contents: bullet |6-7| The giant makes one attack with its bite against one random target within its reach. If no other creatures are within its reach, its eyes glaze over and it becomes stunned until the start of its next turn.

bullet |8-10| The giant makes three attacks against one random target within its reach: one attack with its bite and two with its fists. If no other creatures are within its reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (3d6+5) piercing damage, and the giant magically regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.
description |Fist| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8+5) bludgeoning damage.

title: Stone Giant Dreamwalker
contents: subtitle | Huge Giant (Stone Giant), Chaotic Neutral
property | Saving Throws | Dex +6, Con +9, Wis +3

description |Dreamwalker's Charm| An enemy that starts its turn within 30 feet of the giant must make a DC 13 Charisma saving throw, provided that the giant isn’t incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the giant. A creature charmed in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it succeeds on the saving throw, the creature is immune to this giant’s Dreamwalker's Charm for 24 hours.

title: Stone Giant Dreamwalker Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| The giant makes two attacks with its greatclub.
description |Greatclub| Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) bludgeoning damage.

description |Petrifying Touch| The giant touches one Medium or smaller creature within 10 feet of it that is charmed by it. The target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes petrified, and the giant can adhere the target to its stony body. Greater restoration spells and other magic that can undo petrification have no effect on a petrified creature on the giant unless the giant is dead, in which case the magic works normally, freeing the petrified creature as well as ending the petrified condition on it.

description |Rock| Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10+6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

title: Storm Giant Quintessent
contents: subtitle | Huge Giant (Storm Giant), Chaotic Good
property | Saving Throws | Str +14, Con +10, Wis +10, Cha +9
property | Damage Resistances | Cold; Physical from non-magical
description |Amphibious| The giant can breathe air and water.
description |Multiattack| Two Lightning Swords or Wind Javelin twice.
description |Lightning Sword| Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 40 (9d6+9) lightning damage.

description |Wind Javelin| Throws wind like javelins at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The javelin is considered a magic weapon and deals 19 (3d6+9) piercing damage to the target, striking unerringly. The javelin disappears after it hits.

title: Storm Giant Quintessent Continued: Legendary
contents: description |Legendary Actions (3/Turn)| The giant can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The giant regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

description |Gust| The giant targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates a magical gust of wind around it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet in any horizontal direction the giant chooses.

description |Thunderbolt (2 Actions)| The giant hurls a thunderbolt at a creature it can see within 600 feet of it. The target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

description |One with the Storm (3 Actions)| The giant vanishes, dispersing itself into the storm surrounding its lair. The giant can end this effect at the start of any of its turns, becoming a giant once more and appearing in any location it chooses within its lair. While dispersed, the giant can't take any actions other than lair actions, and it can’t be targeted by attacks, spells, or other effects. The giant can’t use this ability outside its lair, nor can it use this ability if another creature is using a control weather spell or similar magic to quell the storm.

title: Girallon
contents: description |Aggressive| As a bonus action, the girallon can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.
description |Multiattack| The girallon makes five attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage.
description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit. reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) slashing damage.

title: Flind
contents: description |Aura of Blood Thirst| If the flind isn’t incapacitated, any creature with the Rampage trait can make a bite attack as a bonus action while within 10 feet of the flind.
description |Multiattack| The flind makes three attacks: one with each of its different flail attacks or three with its longbow.

description |Flail of Madness| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10+5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must make a melee attack against a random target within its reach on its next turn. If it has no targets within its reach even after moving, it loses its action on that turn.

title: Flind Continued: Legendary
contents: description |Flail of Pain| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 it, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10+5) bludgeoning damage plus 22 (4d10) psychic damage.

description |Flail of Paralysis| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10+5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.
description |Longbow| Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

title: Gnoll Flesh Gnawer
contents: description |Rampage| When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.
description |Multiattack| The gnoll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its shortsword.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.
description |Shortsword| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.
description |Sudden Rush| Until the end of the turn, the gnoll's speed increases by 60 feet and it doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

title: Gnoll Hunter
contents: description |Rampage| When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.
description |Multiattack| The gnoll makes two melee attacks with its spear or two ranged attacks with its longbow.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.
description |Spear| Melee or Ranged Weapon: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing, or 6 (1d8+2) piercing when two hands to make a melee attack.
description |Longbow| Ranged Weapon: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage, and the target’s speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

title: Gnoll Witherling
contents: property | Language | Understands Gnoll but can't speak
description |Rampage| When the witherling reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.
description |Multiattack| The witherling makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its club, or two with its club.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.
description |Club| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) bludgeoning damage.
description |Vengeful Strike| When reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of the witherling, the witherling makes a melee attack.

title: Grung
contents: property | Skills | Athletics +2, Perception +2, Stealth +4, Survival +2
description |Amphibious| The grung can breathe air and water.

description |Poisonous Skin| Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung’s skin must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
description |Standing Leap| The grung's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

title: Grung Continued: Actions
contents:
description |Variant: Grung Poison| Grung poison loses its potency 1 minute after being removed from a grung. A similar breakdown occurs if the grung dies.
A creature poisoned by a grung can suffer an additional effect that varies depending on the grung’s skin color. This effect lasts until the creature is no longer poisoned by the grung.
bullet |Green| The poisoned creature can’t move except to climb or make standing jumps. If the creature is flying, it can’t take any actions or reactions unless it lands.
bullet |Blue| The poisoned creature must shout loudly or otherwise make a loud noise at the start and end of its turn.
bullet |Purple| The poisoned creature feels a desperate need to soak itself in liquid or mud. It can’t take actions or move except to do so or to reach a body of liquid or mud

description |Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage.

title: Grung Elite Warrior
contents: property | Skills | Athletics +2, Perception +2, Stealth +5, Survival +2
description |Amphibious| The grung can breathe air and water.

description |Poisonous Skin| Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung’s skin must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
description |Standing Leap| The grung's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

bullet |Orange| The poisoned creature is frightened of its allies.
bullet |Gold| The poisoned creature is charmed and can speak Grung.

description |Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 it, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage.

description |Shortbow| Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage.

description |Mesmerizing Chirr (Recharge 6)| The grung makes a chirring noise to which grungs are immune. Each humanoid or beast that is within 15 feet of the grung and able to hear it must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the grung’s next turn.

description |Spellcasting| The grung is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following ranger spells:

title: Annis Hag
contents: property | Damage Resistance | Cold; Physical from non-magical weapons
description |Innate Spellcasting| The hag’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). She can innately cast the following spells:
bullet |3/day each:| disguise self (including the form of a Medium humanoid), fog cloud

title: Annis Hag Continued: Action
contents: description |Multiattack| The annis makes three attacks: one with her bite and two with her claws.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6+5) piercing damage.
description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6+5) slashing damage.

description |Crushing Hug| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (9d6+5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target takes 36 (9d6+5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the hag’s turns. The hag can’t make attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

title: Bheur Hag
contents: property | Skills | Nature +4, Perception +4, Stealth +6, Survival +4

description |Graystaff Magic| The hag carries a graystaff, a length of gray wood that is a focus for her inner power. She can ride the staff as if it were a broom of flying. While holding the staff, she can cast additional spells with her Innate Spellcasting trait (these spells are marked with an asterisk). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff.
description |Ice Walk| The hag can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost her extra moment.

title: Bheur Hag Continued: Action
contents: description |Innate Spellcasting| The hag’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
bullet |At will:| hold person,* ray of frost
bullet |3/day each:| cone of cold,* ice storm*, wall of ice*
description |Slam| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:10 (2d8+1) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

description |Maddening Feast| The hag feasts on the corpse of one enemy within 5 feet of her that died within the past minute. Each creature of the hag’s choice that is within 60 feet of her and able to see her must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of her for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature is incapacitated, can't understand what others say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish; the DM controls the creature’s movement, which is erratic. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag’s Maddening Feast for the next 24 hours.

title: Hobgoblin Devastator
contents: description |Arcane Advantage| Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a damaging spell attack if that target is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin and that ally isn’t incapacitated.

description |Army Arcane| When the hobgoblin casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

title: Hobgoblin Devastator Continued: Action
contents: description |Spellcasting| The hobgoblin is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:
bullet |Cantrips (at will):| acid splash, fire bolt, ray of frost, shocking grasp
bullet |2nd level (3 slots):| gust of wind, Melf’s acid arrow, scorching ray
description |Quarterstaff| Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8+1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

title: Hobgoblin Iron Shadow
contents: description |Spellcasting| 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:
bullet |Cantrips (at will):| minor illusion, prestidigitation, true strike
bullet |1st level (3 slots):| charm person, disguise self, expeditious retreat, silent image
description |Unarmored Defense|While unarmored and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

title: Hobgoblin Iron Shadow Continued: Action
contents: description |Multiattack| The hobgoblin makes four attacks, each of which can be an unarmed strike or a dart attack. It can also use Shadow Jaunt once, either before or after one of the attacks.
description |Unarmed Strike| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 it, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) bludgeoning damage.
description |Dart| Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 it, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage.

description |Shadow Jaunt| The hobgoblin magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it is leaving and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

title: Ki-rin
contents: property | Senses | Blindsight 30ft, Darkvision 60ft, Passive Perc. 19
description |Innate Spellcasting| The ki-rin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The ki-rin can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
bullet |At will:| gaseous form, major image (6th-level version), wind walk
description |Legendary Resistance (3/Day)| If the ki-rin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
description |Magic Resistance| The ki-rin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
description |Magic Weapons| The ki-rin’s weapon attacks are magical.

title: Ki-rin Continued: Abilities
contents: description | Spellcasting| The ki-rin is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:
bullet |1st level (4 slots):| command, cure wounds, detect evil and good, protection from evil and good, sanctuary
bullet |4th level (3 slots):| banishment, freedom of movement, guardian of faith
bullet |5th level (3 slots):| greater restoration, mass cure wounds, scrying

title: Ki-rin Continued: Actions
contents: description| Multiattack| The ki-rin makes three attacks: two with its hooves and one with its horn.
description|Hoof| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft, one target. Hit: 10 (2d4+5) bludgeoning damage.
description|Horn| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8+5) piercing damage.

description|Legendary Actions (3/Turn)| The ki-rin can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The ki-rin regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
description|Detect| The ki-rin makes a Wisdom (Perception) check or a Wisdom (Insight) check.
description|Smite| The ki-rin makes a hoof attack or casts sacred flame.
description|Move| The ki-rin moves up to its half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

title: Kobold Dragonshield
contents: description |Dragon's Resistance| The kobold has resistance to a type of damage based on the color of dragon that invested it with power (choose or roll a d10): 1-2, acid (black); 3-4, cold (white); 5-6, fire (red); 7-8, lightning (blue); 9-10, poison (green).

description|Heart of the Dragon| If the kobold is frightened or paralyzed by an effect that allows a saving throw, it can repeat the save at the start of its turn to end the effect on itself and all kobolds within 30 feet of it. Any kobold that benefits from this trait (including the dragonshield) has advantage on its next attack roll.
description|Pack Tactics| The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

title: Kobold Dragonshield Continued: Abilities
contents: description|Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description| Multiattack| The kobold makes two melee attacks.

description|Spear| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 it, one target. Hit: 4 (ld6+l) piercing damage, or 5 (ld8+l) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

title: Kobold Inventor
contents: description| Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing.
description|Weapon Invention| The kobold uses one of the following options (roll a d8 or choose one); the kobold can use each one no more than once per day:
bullet|1. Acid| The kobold hurls a flask of acid. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) acid damage.

bullet|2. Alchemist’s fire| The kobold throws a flask of alchemist's fire. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) fire damage at the start of each of the target’s turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

title: Kobold Inventor Continued: Actions
contents: bullet|3. Basket of Centipedes| The kobold throws a small basket into a S-foot-square space within 20 feet of it. A swarm of insects (centipedes) with 11 hit points emerges from the basket and rolls initiative. At the end of each of the swarm’s turns, there's a 50 percent chance that the swarm disperses.

bullet|4. Green Slime Pot| The kobold throws a clay pot full of green slime at the target, and it breaks open on impact. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. Hit: The target is covered in a patch of green slime (see chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide). Miss: A patch of green slime covers a randomly determined S-foot-square section of wall or floor within 5 feet of the target.

bullet|5. Rot Grub Pot| The kobold throws a clay pot into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it, and it breaks open on impact. A swarm of rot grubs (see appendix A) emerges from the shattered pot and remains a hazard in that square.

bullet|6. Scorpion on a Stick| The kobold makes a melee attack with a scorpion tied to the end of a 5-foot-long pole. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

title: Kobold Inventor Continued: Actions
contents: bullet|7. Skunk in a Cage| The kobold releases a skunk into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The skunk has a walking speed of 20 feet, AC 10, 1 hit point, and no effective attacks. It rolls initiative and, on its turn, uses its action to spray musk at a random creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a DC 9 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target retches and can’t take actions for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that doesn’t need to breathe or is immune to poison automatically succeeds on the saving throw. Once the skunk has sprayed its musk, it can’t do so again until it finishes a short or long rest.

bullet|8. Wasp Nest in a Bag| The kobold throws a small bag into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it. A swarm of insects (wasps) with 11 hit points emerges from the bag and rolls initiative. At the end of each of the swarm's turns, there’s a 50 percent chance that the swarm disperses.

title: Kobold Scaled Sorcerer
contents: description| Spellcasting| The kobold is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:
bullet|1st level (4 slots):| charm person, chromatic orb, expeditious retreat

title: Kobold Scaled Sorcerer Continued: Actions
contents: description|Sorcery Points| Sorcery Points. The kobold has 3 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

bullet|Heightened Spell:| When it casts a spell that forces a creature to a saving throw to resist the spell’s effects, the kobold can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
bullet|Subtle Spell:| When the kobold casts a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components.
description|Pack Tactics| The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature it at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.
description|Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description|Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 it, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

title: Korred
contents: property | Damage Resistances | Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Senses | Darkvision 120ft, Tremorsense 120ft, Passive Perc. 15
property | Language | Dwarvish, Gnomish, Sylvan, Terran, Undercommon

description| Command Hair| The korred has at least one 50-foot-long rope woven out of its hair. As a bonus action, the korred commands one such rope within 30 feet of it to move up to 20 feet and entangle a Large or smaller creature that the korred can see. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or become grappled by the rope (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends. the target is restrained. The korred can use a bonus action to release the target, which is also freed if the korred dies or becomes incapacitated.
A rope of korred hair has AC 20 and 20 hit points. It regains 1 hit point at the start of each of the korred’s turns while it has at least 1 hit point and the korred is alive. If the rope drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

title: Korred Continued: Actions
contents: description|Innate Spellcasting| The korred's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
description|At will:| commune with nature, meld into stone, stone shape
description|1/day each:| conjure elemental (as 6th-level spell; galeb duhr, gargoyle, earth elemental, or xorn only), Otto’s irresistible dance
description|Stone Camouflage| The korred has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.
description|Stone's Strength| While on the ground, the korred deals 2 extra dice of damage with any weapon attack (included in its attacks).
description|Multiattack| The korred makes two attacks with its greatclub or hurls two rocks.
description|Greatclub| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8+6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8+6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.
description|Rock| Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8+6) bludgeoning damage, or 24 (4d8+6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

title: Leucrotta
contents: description|Keen Smell| Advantage on Perception checks based on smell.
description|Kicking Retreat| Using hooves, Disengage as bonus action.
description|Mimicry| Mimics animal sounds and voices. DC14 Insight to tell the difference to tell they are imitations
description|Rampage| Reducing target to 0HP by melee on its turn, bonus action to move half its speed and make hooves attack.
description|Multiattack| The leucrotta makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its hooves.
description|Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) piercing. If the leucrotta scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.
description|Hooves| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) bludgeoning damage.

title: Meenlock
contents: description|Fear Aura| Beast/humanoid starting in 10ft makes DC11 Wisdom save. Failure: frightened till creature’s next turn.
description|Light Sensitivity| In bright light, disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

description|Shadow Teleport (Recharge 5-6)| Bonus action, teleports to an unoccupied space in 30ft, provided that both the space it’s teleporting from and its destination are in dim light or darkness. The destination need not be within line of sight.

description|Claws| Melee: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4+2) slashing Target makes DC11 Constitution save or be paralyzed for 1 minute. Repeats save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

title: Alhoon

property | Saving Throws | Con +7, Int +8, Wis +7, Cha +7
property | Skills | Arcana +8, Deception +7, History +8, Insight +7, Perception +7, Stealth +5
property | Damage Resistances | Cold, Lightning, Necrotic
property | Damage Immunities: | Poison; Physical from non-magical
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Poisoned
property | Language | Deep Speech, Undercommon, Telepathy 120ft
